title: How-to Guide for AI Assistant Integration
description: This guide provides a comprehensive overview of how to effectively integrate and utilize Akira's AI Assistant for enhancing documentation.
author: Akira Documentation Team

blocks.content: 1. Main Use Cases
The AI Assistant can be leveraged for various documentation tasks, including:

Generating Code Examples
Explaining Technical Concepts
Restructuring Content
Creating Documentation Outlines
Translating Documentation
2. Required Setup
To get started with the AI Assistant, ensure you have the following setup:
Prerequisites

Akira Environment
Access to Command Palette
Configuration

ai_assistant:
  model: "advanced-docs-v2"      # Specify the AI model to use
  temperature: 0.7                 # Control the randomness of responses
  max_tokens: 2048                 # Set the maximum length of generated responses
  style_guide: "path/to/style/guide.md"  # Path to your documentation style guide
3. Step-by-Step Examples for Common Operations
Example 1: Generating a Code Example
1. Open the command palette using `Ctrl+Shift+P`.
2. Type `/ai` followed by your request, such as:
/ai Generate a Python function to calculate the factorial of a number.
3. Review the generated code and make necessary adjustments.
Example 2: Explaining a Technical Concept
1. Use the command palette or type `/ai` in a content block.
2. Request an explanation, for example:
/ai Explain the concept of recursion in programming.
3. Read the explanation and edit for clarity if needed.
Example 3: Restructuring Content
1. Highlight the content you wish to restructure.
2. Invoke the AI Assistant using `/ai`.
